summary: This document is a series of urgent emails from August 11-12, 2019, between federal prosecutors and law enforcement regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. It discusses plans to interview multiple Bureau of Prisons staff, including the psychologist who removed Epstein from suicide watch, and outlines logistical and legal procedures for the interviews.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Requested an interview with the psychologist who took Epstein off suicide watch.

persons.name: Amanda
persons.context: Discussed with the email sender the need to interview a list of people, with some marked as most urgent.

persons.name: Joyner
persons.context: Listed as one of the Bureau of Prisons staff members to be interviewed by the FBI as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.

connections.description: Both are involved in coordinating the urgent investigation and interviews following Epstein's death.

events.title: Planning interviews for Epstein death investigation
events.description: Federal prosecutors and law enforcement coordinate to interview multiple Bureau of Prisons staff, including the psychologist who removed Epstein from suicide watch.

events.title: Scheduled FBI interview with Bureau of Prisons psychologist
events.description: An interview is planned with the psychologist (PsyD) who took Epstein off suicide watch.

locations: 1 Battery Park Plaza, 29th floor, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: The emails are from August 11-12, 2019, immediately following Jeffrey Epstein's death, indicating an urgent investigation.
A key interview target is the psychologist (a PsyD) who made the decision to take Epstein off suicide watch.
Prosecutors plan to interview at least 10 Bureau of Prisons staff members, including shift supervisors and officers, with some interviews deemed 'most urgent'.
Interviewees were to be Mirandized and given warnings under 18 U.S.C. ยง 1001 (false statements), and subpoenas were to be issued.
The correspondence shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the FBI.
